divs: sighting details i was at mcdonalds restraunt in midland michigan at about 2 to 3 pm on saturday april 19. i got out of my car to stretch, and happened to look to the east towards saginaw. at first i saw the vapor trail, following the trail i saw the object. but usually you can faintly make out the plane that is making the trail. all that i could make out was a bright object at the end. and usually you will be able to faintly hear the jet, yet this object was silent. i carry a pair of hunting binoculars in my car, i got them out so i could get a better look at it. what i saw was an object that was very bright, and oval in shape. the first thing that i noticed that was odd about this object was its vapor trail. i estimate the object to have been about 1-1 1\2 miles in the air. its vapor trail was wide, about twice the size of the object. the trail was cylindrical in shape and it was spiraled . at first i thought it might be a meteor, but it could not have been, because when it first appeared in the east it was on approximately a 30 degree angle going north, then shifted direction on a more 32 degrees angle. ultimately meteors dont change angles like that. it took only about a minute and a half to travel from east to west.
trends: There have been 10 other sightings in Midland
There were no other sightings in Midland on or around April 19th 2008
Summary: fast moving object comming from the southeast heading northwest.
